ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint Wave data collected
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Block Number
Trial number
DRT Slot Machine Color
The units of reaction time
Block # - Slot machine on the left in Trial #
Notes: 1 = Red; 2 = Orange; 3 = Green; 4 = Purple; 5 = Pink; 9 = None

ElementDescription: Block # - Slot machine on the right in Trial #
Notes: 1 = Red; 2 = Orange; 3 = Green; 4 = Purple; 5 = Pink; 9 = None

ElementDescription: Block # - Slot machine selected in Trial #
Block # - Response time to select a slot machine in Trial #
Block # - Points won in Trial #
Block # - Total points won
Total points won across the three blocks
Learning rate for better-than-expected outcomes; a reinforcement learning modeling parameter using the risk-sensitive temporal difference model
Learning rate for worse-than-expected outcomes; a reinforcement learning modeling parameter using the risk-sensitive temporal difference model
Sensitivity to difference in values between two machines in a choice; a reinforcement learning modeling parameter using the risk-sensitive temporal difference model
Relative difference between drt_alphapos and drt_alphaneg
Notes: AI>0 reflects greater weight of positive prediction errors and AI<0 reflects greater weighting of negative prediction errors

ElementDescription: Mean of all likelihoods of choosing the selected machine at each trial as modeled by the risk-sensitive temporal-difference reinforcement learning model
Overall proportion of trials where the subject selected the risky machine option
Block #: Proportion of trials where the expected values of machines were equal and the subject selected the risky machine option
Overall proportion of trials where the expected values of machines were equal and the subject selected the risky machine option
Block #: Proportion of trials where the expected values of the risky machine was greater than the value of the deterministic machine and the subject selected the risky machine option
Overall proportion of trials where the expected values of the risky machine was greater than the value of the deterministic machine and the subject selected the risky machine option
Block #: Proportion of trials where the expected value of one machine absolutely dominated the other
Whether subjects chose correctly on at least 60% of test trials in the last 2/3 of the task
Overall proportion of risky trials where the expected values of both machines was 20 points and the subject selected the risky machine option
Overall proportion of risky trials where the expected values of both machines was 40 points and the subject selected the risky machine option
Points possible to win when selecting the (color) slot machine
Expected value of (color) slot machine
Probability of winning points when (color) slot machine is selected
Timepoint/visit label
